Name: The Capital Grille
Comments: Service was great and the steaks were awesome. I highly recommend this Capital Grill when In NYC. Everyone was accomodating.
Menu: Check The Website for a Menu

Name: Murray's Cheese
Comments: Murray's Cheeses on Bleecker St NYC is the MECCA for cheese lovers. They have a HUGE variety of cheeses; they even allow taste testing of any cheese you want.

Name: Daniel
Comments: Wonderful restaurant, pleasant. The menu at DANIEL is a French culinary heritage. The food  is amazing.
Menu: Check The Website for a Menu

Name: Los Tacos No. 1
Comments: This place is a must if your a taco fan.  I think it’s the best place to satisfy a Mexican craving.  It’s worth the wait as it will please your tastebuds and you will be back for more.
Menu: http://lostacos1.com/menus/

Name: Red Rooster Harlem
Comments: Make sure you have a reservation as we showed up at our appointed time and there were people waiting for a table. We basically sat right down to the "looks" of them.
Menu: Check The Website for a Menu

Name: Numero 28 Pizzeria
Comments: Our family has become snobby when it comes to pizza.  Chain stores don’t cut it.  THIS pizza wins an award!  We all loved it.  The sauce and toppings were fresh, and the crust was perfect.  Spectacular!
Menu: Check The Website for a Menu

Name: Atera
Comments: Atera is indeed a Michelin grade restaurant, no doubt about that.  But the atmosphere left a lot to be desired.
Menu: Check The Website for a Menu

Name: San Carlo Osteria Piemonte
Comments: Was greatly pleased by this discovery in Soho. The staff is great and the food more than incredible plus a good selection of wine makes this a pleasant place to eat.
Menu: http://www.sancarlonyc.com/menu/

Name: Broadway Bagel
Comments: Very delicious egg & cheese bagel at a very good price. Also try the brownie. It’s worth it for sure :)
Menu: Check The Website for a Menu

Name: Smoke Jazz Club

Comments: Booked here for restaurant week whilst in NYC and got an expensive taxi out from midtown to visit, very disappointed to find that despite it saying clearly online on restaurant week that there was no music charge on Monday.
Menu: Check The Website for a Menu

Name: Jungsik
Comments: Instead of going for the full tasting menu we came here to enjoy their dessert only tasting menu. Understandably, this is served in the bar rather than in the main dining area.

Name: Naruto Ramen
Comments: Good service, satisfying food. Space is cramped, but they serve good value for money. It’s amusing to watch the chefs preparing the meals too.

Name: Boucherie West Village
Comments: Wonderful Sunday Brunch. The Food was delicious and great service. Great atmosphere with French flair.

Name: Dirt Candy
Comments: This was truly the worst meal we've ever eaten (4 of us dined this evening). We stopped for a slice of pizza on the way home so that we could have something edible.
Menu: Check The Website for a Menu

Name: Buenos Aires
Comments: In a city with thousands of places to eat, few are worth the trouble and cost of eating out. Even in NYC, having a great dining experience is not obvious.  Buenos Aires delivers on all expectations- every time.  I've been eating here since it opened.
Menu: Check The Website for a Menu

Name: Decoy Bar
Comments:
Des what a legend!!!!

What this lady doesn’t know about cocktails is not work knowing. We sat at the bar she made us feel very comfortable throughout our dinner/drinks and made sure we was OK.
Menu: http://www.decoynyc.com/menus/

Name: John's Coffee Shop
Comments: Great place, nice people.  I had an egg white, American cheese and potato egg sandwich which was delicious but I thought it was a bit pricey $9.  My boyfriend had an omelet and potatoes which was awesome.  Will visit again when in the city.
Menu: https://www.seamless.com/menu/johns-coffee-shop-823-2nd-ave-new-york/292498?utm_medium=grubhub-owned-menu-properties&utm_source=allmenus.com&utm_content=292498&utm_campaign=menu-page&affiliate=1079

Name: Bleecker Street Pizza
Comments: The pizza slice was good, and the toppings were great (sausage and pepperoni), and the base was quite crispy and a hit like eating toast (but really thin toast). Bleecker Street Pizza came highly recommended and I can see why.
Menu: Check The Website for a Menu

Name: Pure Thai Cookhouse
Comments: Nice to see a restaurant that earns its reviews! Great meal, service and fun atmosphere.  Tiny restaurant- but they expanded so there is another space next to the main space, which was great.

Name: Petite Boucherie
Comments: Beautiful authentic French bistrot. I had a wonderful experience, the service and food were excellent. I will definitely come back. Thank you !

Name: Rafele
Comments: Just perfect on a snowy night in the West Village.  Warm, cozy, lively but still able to have private conversation.  And the food!  Fabulous marinated eggplant on homemade focaccia is complimentary to start.  We shared the fried artichokes, perfectly cooked and delicious.
Menu: Check The Website for a Menu

Name: Blue Smoke Battery Park City
Comments: We had an exceptional experience dinning at Blue Smoke while on vacation from the UK. We ordered the Rhapsody In 'Cue - so you get a bit of al the meats and we weren't disappointed, everything was outstanding!
Menu: Check The Website for a Menu

Name: Loi Estiatorio
Comments: It looked promising, the chef came up to our table, but sadly enough the food wasn't any good. It was bland (we had the lasagna and the mussels) and the lasagna was very dry. There was no sauce in the lasagna at all.
Menu: http://www.loiestiatorio.com/dinner/

Name: Piccola Cucina Osteria

Name: Sea Fire Grill

Name: Cull & Pistol

Sat at the bar- was good fun.

Amazing oysters- had the platter for half dozen: was amazing.

The dumplings next but  was average. 

Had the US blanc de Blanc- was average.

Service was good.
Menu: https://www.cullandpistol.com/menus/
